March 27, 2019\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Built-in integration with Google reCAPTCHA to prevent bots from subscribing to your Mailchimp lists.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Minor improvements to the JavaScript that is loaded on admin pages.\n\n\n#### 4.4.0 - March 1, 2019\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- AffiliateWP integration subscribing the wrong user if affiliate ID differs from user ID.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Renamed \"MailChimp\" to \"Mailchimp\" to match Mailchimp's new branding.\n- More accurate handling of timeouts for accounts with many MailChimp lists.\n- UX improvements for integrations overview page.\n- Validate MailChimp API key format when it's entered.\n- Improved compatibility with Klarna Checkout in the WooCommerce checkout integration.\n- Bumped required PHP version to 5.3 (soft requirement for now).\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Added Gutenberg block for easily adding a form to a post or page.\n- Added subscriber tags setting to forms.\n\n\n#### 4.3.3 - December 31, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Update WPForms integration to properly detect if the WPForms plugin is activated.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Write API request parameters to the debug log in case of connection timeouts.\n- Update JavaScript dependencies.\n\n\n#### 4.3.2 - December 11, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Use of `readonly` function, which is only available in WordPress 4.9 or later.\n\n\n#### 4.3.1 - November 28, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Fatal error on PHP versions older than 5.5\n\n\n#### 4.3 - November 28, 2018\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Added `MC4WP_API_KEY` PHP constant which can be used to set your Mailchimp API key.\n- Add `mc4wp_mailchimp_list_limit` filter hook to modify the maximum number of Mailchimp lists to fetch. Defaults to 200.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Apply `mc4wp_integration_gravity-forms_options` filter hook on Gravity Forms integration options so the checkbox can be prechecked and the checkbox label text modified.\n- The `updated_subscriber` JS event is now fired forms not using AJAX as well (when applicable).\n\n\n#### 4.2.5 - Sep 11, 2018\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Only re-add subscriber to list if we want to re-trigger a double opt-in confirmation email.\n- Change Gravity Forms field name to \"Mailchimp for WordPress\"\n- Get rid of cached result of Mailchimp API connection.\n\n\n#### 4.2.4 - July 9, 2018\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Ensure type-safety on some global variables.\n- Stop showing trashed forms immediately.\n- Pre-check Mailchimp list when creating a new form if there is only 1 list.\n- Send `null` for unknown values in usage tracking data (only when opted-in).\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Add methods for accessing Mailchimp's e-commerce promo code endpoints to API class.\n\n\n#### 4.2.3 - June 11, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Don't wrap \"agree to terms\" input in hyperlink element.\n- Allow [ENTER] key again after field helper overlay is closed.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Fallback to meta-refresh if redirect fails because of \"headers already sent\" error.\n\n\n\n#### 4.2.2 - May 22, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Events Manager integration was not working with logged-in users.\n- Form preview URL should respect admin HTTP(S) scheme.\n- Removed use of PHP 5.4 function.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Add \"agree to terms\" checkbox to field helper.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Add filter `mc4wp_http_request_args`.\n\n\n#### 4.2.1 - April 11, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Namespace usage warning when running PHP 5.2\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Remove obsolete `type` attribute from all `\u003cscript\u003e` tags printed by the plugin.\n- Improved tooltips on settings pages.\n- Do not pre-check integration checkboxes by default.\n- Add textual warnings to settings that may affect [GDPR compliance](https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/gdpr-compliance/).\n- Update translation files.\n\n#### 4.2 - March 5, 2018\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Live form preview while editing form.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Improved [conditional fields logic](https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/conditional-fields-elements/).\n- Debug log now includes request \u0026 response data.\n- [Form JavaScript events](https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/javascript-form-events/) are fired in an isolated thread now, to prevent errors in event callbacks from breaking form functionality.\n- Don't send empty field values to Mailchimp when updating subscribers.\n- Show interest grouping ID in list overview on settings page.\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Ninja Forms export checkbox would always state \"checked\" when form contained a Mailchimp sign-up checkbox.\n\n\n\n#### 4.1.15 - February 7, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Dropdown fields with special characters were not properly passed to Mailchimp.\n- Interest groups with an all-numeric ID were not properly passed to Mailchimp.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Various minor code optimizations\n- Do not redirect when showing \"already subscribed\" warning.\n- Improved scroll to form handling after a form is submitted without AJAX.\n\n\n#### 4.1.14 - January 8, 2018\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Validate method was incorrectly checking required array fields.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Wrap some missing strings in translate calls. Thanks [morlor](https://github.com/morloi).\n- Make it clear that redirecting after successful form submissions will not show the \"subscribed\" message.\n\n\n\n#### 4.1.13 - December 28, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Array to string conversion in default form messages.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Allow marking Gravity Forms sign-up checkbox as a required field.\n\n\n#### 4.1.12 - December 11, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Ninja Forms double opt-in setting was incorrectly inversed.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Simplified form processing \u0026 notice logic.\n- Prevent 404 errors by proactively replacing lowercased `name=\"name\"` input attributes.\n- Updated JavaScript dependencies.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Integration for AffiliateWP.\n\n\n#### 4.1.11 - November 2, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Filter out empty array values when overriding selected Mailchimp lists via `_mc4wp_lists`.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Updated JavaScript dependencies.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Link to the [HTML Forms](https://www.htmlforms.io/) from the plugin settings pages.\n\n\n#### 4.1.10 - October 19, 2017\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Remove unused options from Ninja Forms integration.\n- Now logging all sign-ups from Ninja Forms integrations when using [Mailchimp for WordPress Premium](https://www.mc4wp.com/premium-features/).\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Added Gravity Forms integration. You can now integrate with Gravity Forms by adding the \"Mailchimp\" field to your forms.\n\n\n#### 4.1.9 - September 19, 2017\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Add `\u003clabel\u003e` element to sign-up checkbox for WCAG compatibility.\n- Custom integration now works with Enfold theme's contact form element.\n\n\n#### 4.1.7 \u0026 4.1.8 - September 8, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Properly escape the return value of `add_query_arg` when it is used in HTML attributes to prevent cross-site scripting. Thanks to [Karim Ouerghemmi of RIPS](https://www.ripstech.com/) for responsibly disclosing.\n- Now loading integrations after WPML so that String Translations work properly.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Add sign-up integration for WPForms forms.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Updated internal JS dependencies.\n- Form tag `{data key=\"foo.bar\"}` now allows you to access nested array values.\n\n\n#### 4.1.6 - July 31, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Method on API class for retrieving campaign data.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Show Akamai reference number when an API request is blocked by Mailchimp's firewall.\n- Minor output buffering improvements in form previewer.\n\n\n#### 4.1.5 - June 27, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Failsafe against outputting sign-up checkbox twice in registration forms.\n- Properly close HTML anchor element in French translation files.\n- Fix BuddyPress sign-ups when using WordPress Multisite.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Fire action hook `mc4wp_form_updated_subscriber` whenever a form was used to update a subscriber in Mailchimp.\n- Increase browser timeout for AJAX request when fetching Mailchimp lists.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Added campaign \u0026 template methods to API client class.\n\n\n\n#### 4.1.4 - June 15, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Some form specific JS events were not firing due to incorrect event names.\n- Registration form integration now works with WooCommerce registration form.\n- Notice that asks for a plugin review would re-appear after dismissing it.\n\n\n#### 4.1.3 - May 24, 2017\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Randomise time of cron event that renews Mailchimp lists.\n- Always try to show Mailchimp list info when API key is given.\n\n\n#### 4.1.2 - May 8, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Use earlier hook priority for Ninja Forms 3 integration so action is registered on time.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Improved Mailchimp list fetching \u0026 memory usage for accounts with many lists.\n- Show error message when fetching lists fails.\n- Updated plugin translations.\n\n#### 4.1.1 - April 11, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- WPML String Translation not working with the checkbox label for sign-up integrations.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Use updated order methods when using WooCommerce 3.0, thanks to Liam McArthur.\n- Updated JavaScript dependencies.\n\n\n#### 4.1.0 - March 14, 2017\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Updated all JavaScript dependencies in the plugin.\n- Failsafed filter hooks to prevent invalid variable types.\n- Explain that greyed out integrations means that specific plugin is not activated.\n- Conditional form elements now uses event delegation, so it works with forms in [Boxzilla pop-ups](https://boxzillaplugin.com/).\n- Updated language files.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Added support for Ninja Forms 3.\n- Added `mc4wp_integration_show_checkbox` filter.\n\n\n#### 4.0.13 - February 8, 2017\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Ensure fields are HTML decoded before sending to Mailchimp.\n- Better OptimizePress compatibility.\n- Show all address-type fields as required when form contains 1 or more fields of the same address group.\n\n\n#### 4.0.12 - January 16, 2017\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Don't call `stripslashes` on POST data twice.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Plugin review notice is now dismissible over AJAX.\n- Improved formatting of birthday fields.\n- Updated Polish translations, thanks to Mateusz Lomber.\n- Updated German translations, thanks to Sven de Vries.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Add `update_ecommerce_store_product` method to API class.\n- Throw form specific JavaScript events, like `15.subscribed` to hook into \"subscribed\" events for form with ID 15.\n\n\n#### 4.0.11 - December 9, 2016\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Unescaped request variable on integration settings page, allowing for authenticated XSS. Thanks to [dxwsecurity](https://security.dxw.com/) for responsibly disclosing.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Add `$args` parameter to `API::get_lists_activity` method. Relates to the [Mailchimp Activity](https://wordpress.org/plugins/mc4wp-activity/) plugin.\n\n\n#### 4.0.10 - December 6, 2016\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- You can now enable or disable debug logging from the \"Other\" settings page.\n- No longer using deprecated function in Contact Form 7, thanks to [stodorovic](https://github.com/stodorovic).\n- Improved UI for adding hidden interest groupings fields to a form.\n\n\n#### 4.0.9 - November 23, 2016\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Issue with escaped HTML when using form tags introduced by previous update.\n\n\n#### 4.0.8 - November 23, 2016\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Improved handling of large debug logs.\n- Improved error messages when writing exceptions to debug log.\n- Show notice when form is missing required Mailchimp fields.\n- Custom form integration now handles arrays with 1-level depth. Thanks to [Mardari Igor](https://github.com/GarryOne).\n- You can now use nested tags in your form code, eg `{data key=\"utm_source\" default=\"{current_path}\"}`\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Add `data-hide-if` attribute logic to forms. See [conditionally hide form fields](https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/conditional-fields-elements/). Thanks to [Kurt Zenisek](http://kurtzenisek.com/).\n- Add hooks for delayed BuddyPress sign-up. Thanks to [Christian Wach](https://profiles.wordpress.org/needle).\n\n\n#### 4.0.7 - October 25, 2016\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Obfuscate all email addresses in debug log. Thanks [Sauli Lepola](https://twitter.com/SJLfi).\n- Ask for confirmation before disabling double opt-in, which we do not recommend.\n- Allow vertical resizing of debug log.\n- Failsafe against including JavaScript file twice.\n- No longer wrapping CF7 checkbox in paragraph tags.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Added `mc4wp_form_api_error` action hook for API errors encountered by forms.\n- Added `element_class` argument to `[mc4wp_form]` shortcode for adding CSS classes.\n\n\n#### 4.0.6 - October 10, 2016\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Issue with lists not showing when using W3 Total Cache with APCu object cache enabled.\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- We're no longer stripping newlines from text fields.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Added missing e-commerce related API methods to API class.\n\n\n#### 4.0.5 - September 29, 2016\n\n**Fixes**\n\n- Allow checkbox option for the List Choice field (again).\n\n**Improvements**\n\n- Fetch Mailchimp lists over AJAX, to speed up perceived performance (especially when your account has many lists).\n- Periodically fetch Mailchimp lists, so cache is always fresh.\n- Improved `\u003clabel\u003e` element accessibility for checkbox integrations.\n- Stop using double underscore prefix in function names, as these are reserved in PHP 7.\n- `{post}` and `{user}` shortcodes now accept a `default` parameter.\n\n**Additions**\n\n- Add [MemberPress](https://www.memberpress.com/) integration.\n- Add missing e-commerce related API methods for next week's [WooCommerce Mailchimp e-commerce integration](https://www.mc4wp.com/kb/what-is-ecommerce/) release.\n\n\n#### 4.0.4 - Written the WordPress way.\n\n== Description ==\n\nMax Mega Menu will automatically convert your existing menu into a mega menu. You can then add any WordPress widget to your menu, restyle your menu using the theme editor and change the menu behaviour using the built in settings. Max Mega Menu is a complete menu management plugin, perfect for taking control of your existing menu and turning it into a user-friendly, accessible and touch ready menu with just a few clicks.\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=44dJwP1AXT8\n\nDocumentation \u0026 Demo: [https://www.megamenu.com](https://www.megamenu.com)\n\n###Mobile\n\n* Automatic support for native touch events\n* Off Canvas Mobile Menu option built in\n* Specify your own Responsive Breakpoint\n* For items with sub menus, choose between \"First click opens sub menu, second click closes sub menu\" or \"First click opens sub menu, second click follows link\"\n* Option to hide sub menus on mobile\n* Mobile Toggle Bar designer allows you to tailor the toggle bar elements to fit in with your site design\n\n###Features\n\n* Builds upon the standard WordPress menus system\n* Restores the *Appearance \u003e Menus* screen in \"full site editing\" themes\n* Supports multiple menu locations each with their own configuration\n* Off canvas (slide in from left or right) or standard drop down mobile menu\n* Organise your sub menu content into rows and columns using the Grid Layout builder\n* Display WordPress Widgets in your menu\n* Fully customise the styling of your menus using the built in theme editor\n* Supports Flyout (traditional) or Mega Menu sub menu styles\n* Hover, Hover Intent or Click event to open sub menus\n* Fade, Fade Up, Slide Up or Slide sub menu transitions\n* Add icons to menu items\n* Menu item options including Hide Text, Disable Link, Hide on Mobile etc\n* Align menu items to the left or right of the menu bar\n* Align sub menus to left or right of parent menu item\n* Display your menu using Automatic Integration, Block, Widget or Shortcode.\n\n###Accessibility\n\n* Keyboard Navigation built in\n* `TAB` activates keyboard navigation and navigates through the menu\n* `ENTER` or `SPACE` on a sub menu arrow indicator shows/hides the sub menu\n* `ESC` closes all open sub menus\n\nMax Mega Menu is developed with a focus on code quality, performance and usability.\n\n* The only mega menu plugin with zero \"!important\", block or inline CSS styles\n* Menus are styled using a single, static CSS file\n* Less than 2kb JavaScript (when gzipped)\n* Responsive, touch \u0026 retina ready\n* Built with accessibility in mind - keyboard navigation supported\n* Extensively tested in all modern desktop and mobile browsers\n* Clean code with a low memory footprint\n* Supports all core nav_menu filters (prepend filter name with \"mega_\")\n* In depth documentation\n* Basic Support included with free version\n\n####Pro Features:\n\n\u003e * Tabbed Mega Menus\n\u003e * Sticky Menu\n\u003e * Vertical \u0026 Accordion Menus\n\u003e * FontAwesome, Genericon \u0026 Custom Icons\n\u003e * Custom Item Styling\n\u003e * Menu Logo\n\u003e * Search Box\n\u003e * WooCommerce \u0026 EDD support\n\u003e * Google Fonts\n\u003e * Roles \u0026 Restrictions\n\u003e * Mobile toggle blocks\n\u003e * Automatic updates\n\u003e * Priority Support\n\u003e\n\u003e Find out more: [https://www.megamenu.com/upgrade/](https://www.megamenu.com/upgrade/)\n\n== Frequently Asked Questions ==\n\n= Is it compatible with Elementor? =\nYes! See: [https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/elementor/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/elementor/)\n\n= Where do I start? =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/installation/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/installation/)\n\n= It‚Äôs not working at all =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/not-working-at-all/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/not-working-at-all/)\n\n= It works but somethings not right =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/it-works-but-somethings-not-right/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/it-works-but-somethings-not-right/)\n\n= The mobile menu is visible but nothing happens when I click it =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/the-mobile-menu-is-visible-but-nothing-happens-when-i-click-it/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/the-mobile-menu-is-visible-but-nothing-happens-when-i-click-it/)\n\n= The mobile menu is completely hidden =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/the-mobile-menu-is-completely-hidden/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/the-mobile-menu-is-completely-hidden/)\n\n= I see two mobile toggle buttons =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/i-see-two-mobile-toggle-buttons/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/i-see-two-mobile-toggle-buttons/)\n\n= A blank screen appears when I click the blue ‚ÄòMega Menu‚Äô button =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/blank-screen-when-clicking-blue-mega-menu/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/blank-screen-when-clicking-blue-mega-menu/)\n\n= Changes I make in the Theme Editor aren‚Äôt being applied to the menu =\n[https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/theme-editor-not-working/](https://www.megamenu.com/documentation/theme-editor-not-working/)\n\n== Installation ==\n\n1. Go to the Plugins Menu in WordPress\n1. Search for \"Max Mega Menu\"\n1. Click \"Install\"\n\nhttps://www.megamenu.com/documentation/installation/\n\n== Screenshots ==\n\nSee https://www.megamenu.com for more screenshots\n\n1. New menu changes\n2. Drag and Drop widget editor for each menu item\n3. Front end: Mega Menu\n4. Front end: Flyout Menu\n5. Back end: Use the theme editor to change the appearance of your menus\n\n== Changelog ==\n\n= 3.6.2 =\n\n* Accessibility Fix: Windows Narrator ignores \"Enter\" keypress, preventing tab navigation working reliably\n* Fix: CSS generation fails when outdated versions of MMM Pro are installed (\u003c= 2.3.1)\n* Fix: PHP notice\n* Change: Add css_type SCSS variable\n* Fix: Colorpicker z-index\n\n= 3.6.1 =\n\n* Fix: PHP Error when percentage sign used in HTML block in menu toggle bar\n\n= 3.6 =\n\n* New: Experimental 'Use Flex CSS' option added to theme editor for new installations of MMM (will become available to existing installations in future versions)\n* New: Color picker in theme editor updated to allow CSS variables to be entered\n* New: Allow 'wv' units to be used to define sub menu width (e.g. 100vw will make the sub menu full browser width)\n* Update: Reusable block widget renamed to Pattern widget (use this to show saved Block Patterns within your sub menus)\n* Fix: Double blue 'Mega Menu' button in Enfold theme\n* Fix: Mobile close button sometimes disappears (use options rather than transients to store CSS version and generation date)\n* Fix: Sub menu items in mega menus don't appear on mobile when flex styling is used\n* Fix: Do not apply collapse children class to tabbed menu items\n* Improvement: Use more reliable/cleaner method to add toggle bar html to menu output\n* Accessibility: Change standard menu toggle span to button, for NVDA screen readers\n\n= 3.5 =\n\n* New: Dedicated Elementor Widget\n* Accessibility Improvement: Add presentation role to grid layout containers to prevent NVDA from announcing them\n* Accessibility Improvement: Add aria-hidden attribute to arrow indicators\n* Accessibility Fix: Pressing Enter on standard mobile toggle button now opens/closes mobile sub menu\n* Improvement: Use style attributes on grid layout to define number of rows and columns, in preparation for using CSS Grid styling\n* Improvement: Refactor mobile CSS, remove usage of :has\n* Improvement: Refactor second and third level item styling so that it can be used within tab sub menus without being duplicated\n* Improvement: Refactor method for adding close button HTML to menu output\n* Improvement: Refactor JS: remove usage of data-has-click-event attribute\n* Fix: Fix styling of mobile menu as it transitions from open to closed\n* Fix: Error loading scss in some instances\n\n= 3.4.1 =\n\n* Fix: PHP 5.6 compatibility\n\n= 3.4 =\n\n* New: Allow off canvas menus to be 100% wide\n* New: Add option to Theme Editor to add a Close icon to off canvas mobile menus\n* Accessibility Fix: Remove 'aria-haspopup' attribute\n* Fix: Dynamic sub menu width calculation bug\n* Accessibility Improvement: Escape key now closes sub menus sequentially\n* Improvement: Small refactor of maxmegamenu.js\n* Improvement: Set default mobile menu type to Off Canvas\n\n= 3.3.2 =\n\n* Fix: CSS validation error (move @charset rule to first line)\n* Fix: jQuery migrate warnings (change unbind to off)\n* Accessibility Fix: On mobile, when pressing enter on the parent of a hidden submenu, follow the link\n* Fix: PHP warning when activating plugin for first time using PHP 8.2\n* Fix: When CSS Output has been set to 'Disabled', do not automatically set it back to 'Output in Head' if generation of the CSS file fails\n\n= 3.3.1 =\n\n* Accessibility Improvement: Ensure items within hidden off canvas menu cannot be focused using keyboard\n* Fix: 'Desktop' mode detection when using browser zoom\n* Fix: Conflict with Darklup Pro (and possibly other plugins which use scssphp library)\n* Fix: Always use 'direct' filesystem method to generate style.css file\n* Fix: jQuery migrate warnings\n* Security fix: Add nonce check to sandbox URL. Thanks to patchstack for reporting.\n\n= 3.3 =\n\n* Fix: PHP 8.2 compatibility (update scssphp library to v1.11.1)\n* Notes: If you have problems with CSS Compilation (menu appears unstyled) add the following to your wp-config.php file:\n`define('MEGAMENU_SCSS_COMPILER_COMPAT', true);`\n* Fix: Conflict with Salient when enabled on Multisite\n* Fix: Improve efficiency of key press detection\n* Accessibility Improvement: Using keyboard navigation on mobile, respect the 'Mobile sub menu behaviour' setting (do not auto close sub menus)\n* Accessibility Improvement: Fix issue with NVDA/screen readers not able to open sub menus using Enter key\n\n= 3.2.4 =\n\n* Change: Remove \"visibility: visible;\" rule from menu UL\n* Fix: Warning with Ninja Popups plugin\n* Accessibility improvement: Space bar can now be used to toggle visibility of mobile sub menu\n* Accessibility improvement: Up/down keys can be used to navigate top level menu items in mobile sub menu\n* Accessibility improvement: Add 'Keyboard Highlight Outline' styling option to theme editor\n* Accessibility improvement: Add outline to entire search form when using keyboard navigation\n* Fix: Using left/right arrow keys to navigate top level menu items when a search box is in the menu\n* Improvement: Remove 'display' inline CSS attribute when mobile menu is opened/closed\n\n= 3.2.3 =\n\n* Fix: Check the walker property exists before adding menu toggle to HTML output\n* Fix: PHP 8.1 warning\n* Fix: Conflict with The Bluehost Plugin\n\n= 3.2.2 =\n\n* Fix: Position of aria-expanded and aria-haspopup attributes\n* Fix: Do not use ':has' selector in CSS unless required\n\n= 3.2.1 =\n\n* Fix: Nested collapsed children CSS\n\n= 3.2 =\n\n* Revert: Remove tabindex from arrow indicator due to HTML validation errors, restore pre 3.1 tab/focus behaviour\n* New: Introduce experimental \"MEGAMENU_EXPERIMENTAL_MOVE_ARROW\" option to move arrow indicator HTML alongside the link element and allow separate keyboard focus (requires clearing the CSS Cache after enabling)\n* Fix: PHP 8.1 compatibility\n\n= 3.1.1 =\n\n* Fix: Pressing Enter on a menu item where the arrow indicator has been hidden should first show the sub menu, then follow the link.\n* Fix: Mobile menu slides down, but does not slide back up\n* Improvement: Make it possible to dequeue hoverIntent without causing JavaScript errors\n\n= 3.1 =\n\n* Accessibility improvement: sub menus no longer appear automatically when parent items are tabbed to. Each sub menu arrow indicator can now be tabbed to and activated (by pressing Enter) independently. Note: it is required to clear the CSS cache to enable correct focus highlighting of the arrow indicators when using keyboard navigation, see megamenu.com for a demonstration.\n* Accessibility improvement: add \"aria-current\" attribute to current menu items\n* Accessibility improvement: space bar key press on sub menu indicator now shows/hides sub menu\n* Accessibility improvement: add role='button' to sub menu indicator arrow\n* Accessibility improvement: add aria-label attribute to sub menu indicator arrow which identifies the sub menu that will be opened/closed when activated\n* Fix: Correct Requi

			human_readable_summary:=== AI Recon Summary Result ===
Target Domain: ticketblox.com
Run ID: 223e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000
Timestamp: 2025-09-02T12:00:29.766109+00:00

==========================

### Executive Summary

Our reconnaissance of ticketblox.com revealed a robust external presence, including numerous subdomains and multiple IP addresses. The principal web services observed are hosted on AWS infrastructure and consist of a web server running Nginx on standard HTTP and HTTPS ports. The domain utilizes Google services for email delivery but lacks DNSSEC protection, which could leave it vulnerable to various types of DNS attacks. A significant number of subdomains, some potentially for development or testing purposes, were uncovered and may contribute to an expanded attack surface. While no direct evidence of vulnerabilities was found, several misconfigurations and exposure indicators suggest a need for closer review and potentially improved security practices.

### Tool Coverage

- **Nmap**: Identified open ports and running services on the primary IP.
- **Dnsrecon**: Provided a detailed view of DNS records and exposed some potential misconfigurations.
- **TheHarvester**: Gathered information about subdomains and associated IP addresses.
- **Subfinder**: Identified additional subdomains, increasing the known scope of the network presence.

### Asset Inventory

- **IPs**:
  - 75.2.70.75
  - 99.83.190.102
  - Extensive IPs (43 total) discovered by TheHarvester.

- **Open Ports**:
  - 80/tcp: HTTP (Nginx)
  - 443/tcp: HTTPS (Nginx)

- **Domains and Subdomains**:
  - ticketblox.com
  - Key subdomains: admin.ticketblox.com, events.ticketblox.com, testing.ticketblox.com, among others (151 identified).

- **DNS Records**:
  - NS: ns35.domaincontrol.com, ns36.domaincontrol.com
  - MX: Utilizing Google's mail servers.
  - TXT: Includes SPF, DMARC records, and verification tags for Google and Facebook.

### Key Findings

- A large number of subdomains suggest a significant attack surface.
- DNSSEC is not configured, leaving the domain susceptible to DNS spoofing threats.
- Infrastructure includes numerous public subdomains likely used for testing or demonstrations, indicating potential exposure points.

### Indicators of Exposure

- Numerous public-facing subdomains, some possibly for non-production use.
- Lack of DNSSEC increases risk of DNS-based attacks.
- An extensive DNS and IP footprint that might not be fully vetted in security practices.

### Security Implications

The lack of DNSSEC may allow attackers to perform man-in-the-middle attacks via DNS spoofing. The wide range of identified subdomains may lead to potential unauthorized access points, particularly if these subdomains host applications with vulnerabilities or configurations intended only for internal use. The presence of development or test subdomains in a production environment without proper security controls may facilitate targeted attacks.

### Severity Rating

**Medium** ‚Äî While there are no immediate, critical vulnerabilities identified, the absence of DNSSEC and substantial number of public-facing subdomains elevate the security risk profile.

### Recommendations

- Implement DNSSEC to secure DNS communications.
- Conduct an audit of all subdomains and assess the necessary security controls to prevent unauthorized access.
- Regularly review and update server configurations and software to safeguard against vulnerabilities.

### Suggested Next Steps

- Engage in a comprehensive security assessment and penetration testing of the exposed subdomains.
- Verify the necessity and security of each public-facing subdomain.
- Apply security best practices in cloud service usage, ensuring proper configuration.

### Technical Details

- **Nmap Scan**: Open ports on 75.2.70.75 include 80 (http), 443 (https) with Nginx running.
- **DNS Records from Dnsrecon**: Multiple MX records pointing to Google, NS records to GoDaddy's domain control, missing DNSSEC.
- **Subfinder & TheHarvester**: Exposed numerous subdomains and related IPs, demonstrating wide external reach.

mode=block\r\n\r\n=== Advanced Custom Fields (ACF¬Æ) ===\nContributors: deliciousbrains, wpengine, elliotcondon, mattshaw, lgladdy, antpb, johnstonphilip, dalewilliams, polevaultweb\nTags: acf, fields, custom fields, meta, repeater\nRequires at least: 6.0\nTested up to: 6.8.2\nRequires PHP: 7.4\nStable tag: 6.5.0\nLicense: GPLv2 or later\nLicense URI: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html\n\nACF helps customize WordPress with powerful, professional and intuitive fields. Proudly powering over 2 million sites, WordPress developers love ACF.\n\n== Description ==\n\nAdvanced Custom Fields (ACF¬Æ) turns WordPress sites into a fully-fledged content management system by giving you all the tools to do more with your data.\n\nUse the ACF plugin to take full control of your WordPress edit screens, custom field data, and more.\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9C6_roqghZQ\u0026rel=0\n\n**Add fields on demand.**\nThe ACF field builder allows you to quickly and easily add fields to WP edit screens with only the click of a few buttons! Whether it's something simple like adding an ‚Äúauthor‚Äù field to a book review post, or something more complex like the structured data needs of an ecommerce site or marketplace, ACF makes adding fields to your content model easy.\n\n**Add them anywhere.**\nFields can be added all over WordPress including posts, pages, users, taxonomy terms, media, comments and even custom options pages! It couldn't be simpler to bring structure to the WordPress content creation experience.\n\n**Show them everywhere.**\nLoad and display your custom field values in any theme template file with our hassle-free, developer friendly functions! Whether you need to display a single value or generate content based on a more complex query, the out-of-the-box functions of ACF make templating a dream for developers of all levels of experience.\n\n**Any Content, Fast.**\nTurning WordPress into a true content management system is not just about custom fields. Creating new custom post types and taxonomies is an essential part of building custom WordPress sites. Registering post types and taxonomies is now possible right in the ACF UI, speeding up the content modeling workflow without the need to touch code or use another plugin.\n\n**Simply beautiful and intentionally accessible.**\nFor content creators and those tasked with data entry, the field user experience is as intuitive as they could desire while fitting neatly into the native WordPress experience. Accessibility standards are regularly reviewed and applied, ensuring ACF is able to empower as close to anyone as possible.\n\n**Documentation and developer guides.**\nOver 10 plus years of vibrant community contribution alongside an ongoing commitment to clear documentation means that you'll be able to find the guidance you need to build what you want.\n\n= Features =\n* Simple \u0026 Intuitive\n* Powerful Functions\n* Over 30 Field Types\n* Extensive Documentation\n* Millions of Users\n\n= Links =\n* [Website](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Website)\n* [Documentation](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Website)\n* [Support](https://support.advancedcustomfields.com)\n* [ACF PRO](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/pro/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade)\n\n= PRO =\nThe Advanced Custom Fields plugin is also available in a professional version which includes more fields, more functionality, and more flexibility. The ACF PRO plugin features:\n\n* The [Repeater Field](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/repeater/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade) allows you to create a set of sub fields which can be repeated again, and again, and again.\n* [ACF Blocks](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/blocks/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade), a powerful PHP-based framework for developing custom block types for the WordPress Block Editor (aka Gutenberg).\n* Define, create, and manage content with the [Flexible Content Field](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/flexible-content/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade), which provides for multiple layout and sub field options.\n* Use the [Options Page](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/options-page/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade) feature to add custom admin pages to edit ACF fields.\n* Build fully customisable image galleries with the [Gallery Field](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/gallery/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade).\n* Unlock a more efficient workflow for managing field settings by reusing existing fields and field groups on demand with the [Clone Field](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/clone/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade).\n\n[Upgrade to ACF PRO](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/pro/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Pro%20Upgrade)\n\n== Installation ==\n\nFrom your WordPress dashboard\n\n1. **Visit** Plugins \u003e Add New\n2. **Search** for \"Advanced Custom Fields\" or ‚ÄúACF‚Äù\n3. **Install and Activate** Advanced Custom Fields from your Plugins page\n4. **Click** on the new menu item \"ACF\" and create your first custom field group, or register a custom post type or taxonomy.\n5. **Read** the documentation to [get started](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/resources/getting-started-with-acf/?utm_source=wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=free%20plugin%20listing\u0026utm_campaign=ACF%20Website)\n\n\n== Frequently Asked Questions ==\n\n= What kind of support do you provide? =\n\n**Support Forums.** Our ACF Community Forums provide a great resource for searching and finding previously answered and asked support questions. You may create a new thread on these forums, however, it is not guaranteed that you will receive an answer from our support team. This is more of an area for ACF developers to talk to one another, post ideas, plugins and provide basic help. [View the Support Forum](https://support.advancedcustomfields.com/)\n\n\n== Screenshots ==\n\n1. Simple \u0026 Intuitive\n\n2. Made for Developers\n\n3. All About Fields\n\n4. Registering Custom Post Types\n\n5. Registering Taxonomies\n\n\n== Changelog ==\n\n= 6.5.0 =\n*Release Date 11th August 2025*\n\n* New - Flexible Content layouts can now be renamed in the post editor, giving content editors better clarity when managing layouts\n* New - Flexible Content layouts can now be disabled, preventing them from rendering on the frontend without needing to delete their data\n* New - Flexible Content layouts can now be collapsed and expanded in bulk for faster content editing\n* New - Editing a Flexible Content layout now highlights the layout being edited, making it easier to identify\n* New - The Date and Date Time Picker fields can now be configured to default to the current date\n* Fix - Custom Icon Picker tabs now work correctly when used inside an ACF Block\n* Fix - Duplicating a Field Group no longer causes a fatal error when using Russian translations\n* Fix - ACF classes no longer use dynamic class properties, improving compatibility with PHP 8.2+\n* Fix - ACF PRO no longer shows an update available immediately after updating to the latest version\n* Fix - Field group metabox collapse and expand buttons are no longer misaligned in the post editor\n* Fix - The ACF Site Health section no longer causes a PHP warning when field group location rules are incomplete\n* Security - HTML is now escaped from field validation errors and tooltips\n\n= 6.4.3 =\n*Release Date 22nd July 2025*\n\n* Security - Unsafe HTML in field group labels is now correctly escaped for conditionally loaded field groups, resolving a JS execution vulnerability in the classic editor\n* Security - HTML is now escaped from field group labels when output in the ACF admin\n* Security - Bidirectional and Conditional Logic Select2 elements no longer render HTML in field labels or post titles\n* Security - The `acf.escHtml` function now uses the third party DOMPurify library to ensure all unsafe HTML is removed. A new `esc_html_dompurify_config` JS filter can be used to modify the default behaviour\n* Security - Post titles are now correctly escaped whenever they are output by ACF code. Thanks to Shogo Kumamaru of LAC Co., Ltd. for the responsible disclosure\n* Security - An admin notice is now displayed when version 3 of the Select2 library is used, as it has now been deprecated in favor of version 4\n\n= 6.4.2 =\n*Release Date 20th May 2025*\n\n* New - In ACF PRO, fields can now be added to WooCommerce Subscriptions when using HPOS\n* Security - Changing a field type no longer enables the \"Allow Access to Value in Editor UI\" setting\n* Fix - Paginated Repeater fields no longer save duplicate values when saving to a WooCommerce Order with HPOS disabled\n* Fix - Blocks registered via acf_register_block_type() with a `parent` value of `null` no longer fail to register\n\n= 6.4.1 =\n*Release Date 8th May 2025*\n\n* New - Select fields can now be configured to allow creating new options when editing the field's value (requires the \"Stylized UI\" and \"Multiple\" field settings to be enabled)\n* Enhancement - The \"Escaped HTML\" warning notice [introduced in ACF 6.2.5](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/blog/acf-6-2-5-security-release/) is now disabled by default\n* Enhancement - The Icon Picker field now supports supplying an array of icons to a custom tab via a new `acf/fields/icon_picker/{tab_name}/icons` filter\n* Fix - ACF Blocks are now forced into preview mode when editing a synced pattern\n* Fix - The free ACF plugin once again works with the Classic Widgets plugin and the legacy ACF Options Page addon\n* Fix - ACF no longer causes an infinite loop in bbPress when editing replies\n\n= 6.4.0.1 =\n*Release Date 8th April 2025*\n\n* Fix - Calling `acf_get_reference()` with an invalid field name no longer causes a fatal error\n\n= 6.4.0 =\n*Release Date 7th April 2025*\n\n* New - In ACF PRO, fields can now be added to WooCommerce orders when using HPOS\n* Enhancement - ACF now uses Composer to autoload some classes\n* Fix - Repeater pagination now works when the Repeater is inside a Group field\n* Fix - Various translations are no longer called before the WordPress `init` action hook\n* Security - Link field no longer has a minor local XSS vulnerability\n* i18n - Various British English translation strings no longer have a quoting issue breaking links\n* i18n - Added Dutch (formal) translations (props @toineenzo)\n\n= 6.3.12 =\n*Release Date 21st January 2025*\n\n* Enhancement - Error messages that occur when field validation fails due an insufficient security nonce now have additional context\n* Fix - Duplicated ACF blocks no longer lose their field values after the initial save when block preloading is enabled\n* Fix - ACF Blocks containing complex field types now behave correctly when React StrictMode is enabled\n\n= 6.3.11 =\n*Release Date 12th November 2024*\n\n* Enhancement - Field Group keys are now copyable on click\n* Fix - Repeater tables with fields hidden by conditional logic now render correctly\n* Fix - ACF Blocks now behave correctly in React StrictMode\n* Fix - Edit mode is no longer available to ACF Blocks with an WordPress Block API version of 3 as field editing is not supported in the iframe\n\n= 6.3.10.2 =\n*Release Date 29th October 2024*\n*Free Only Release*\n\n* Fix - ACF Free no longer causes a fatal error when any unsupported legacy ACF addons are active\n\n= 6.3.10.1 =\n*Release Date 29th October 2024*\n*Free Only Release*\n\n* Fix - ACF Free no longer causes a fatal error when WPML is active\n\n= 6.3.10 =\n*Release Date 29th October 2024*\n\n* Security - Setting a metabox callback for custom post types and taxonomies now requires being an admin, or super admin for multisite installs\n* Security - Field specific ACF nonces are now prefixed, resolving an issue where third party nonces could be treated as valid for AJAX calls\n* Enhancement - A new ‚ÄúClose and Add Field‚Äù option is now available when editing a field group, inserting a new field inline after the field being edited\n* Enhancement - ACF and ACF PRO now share the same plugin updater for improved reliability and performance\n* Fix - Exporting post types and taxonomies containing metabox callbacks now correctly exports the user defined callback\n\n= 6.3.9 =\n*Release Date 15th October 2024*\n\n* Security - Editing an ACF Field in the Field Group editor can no longer execute a stored XSS vulnerability. Thanks to Duc Luong Tran (janlele91) from Viettel Cyber Security for the responsible disclosure\n* Security - Post Type and Taxonomy metabox callbacks no longer have access to any superglobal values, hardening the original fix from 6.3.8 further\n* Fix - ACF fields now correctly validate when used in the block editor and attached to the sidebar\n\n= 6.3.8 =\n*Release Date 7th October 2024*\n\n* Security - ACF defined Post Type and Taxonomy metabox callbacks no longer have access to $_POST data. (Thanks to the Automattic Security Team for the disclosure)\n\n= 6.3.7 =\n*Release Date 2nd October 2024*\n\n* Security - ACF Free now uses its own update mechanism from WP Engine servers\n\n= 6.3.6 =\n*Release Date 28th August 2024*\n\n* Security - Newly added fields now have to be explicitly set to allow access in the content editor (when using the ACF shortcode or Block Bindings) to increase the security around field permissions. [See the release notes for more details](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/blog/acf-6-3-6/#field-value-access-editor)\n* Security Fix - Field labels are now correctly escaped when rendered in the Field Group editor, to prevent a potential XSS issue. Thanks to Ryo Sotoyama of Mitsui Bussan Secure Directions, Inc. for the responsible disclosure\n* Fix - Validation and Block AJAX requests nonces will no longer be overridden by third party plugins\n* Fix - Detection of third party select2 libraries will now default to v4 rather than v3\n* Fix - Block previews will now display an error if the render template PHP file is not found\n\n= 6.3.5 =\n*Release Date 1st August 2024*\n\n* Fix - The ACF Shortcode now correctly outputs a comma separated list of values for arrays\n* Fix - ACF Blocks rendered in auto mode now correctly re-render their previews after editing fields\n* Fix - ACF Block validation no longer raises required validation messages if HTML will automatically select the first value when rendered\n* Fix - ACF Block validation no longer raises required validation messages if a default value will be rendered as the field value\n* Fix - ACF Block validation no longer raises required validation messages for fields hidden by conditional logic when adding a new block\n\n= 6.3.4 =\n*Release Date 18th July 2024*\n\n* Security Fix - The ACF shortcode now prevents access to fields from different private posts by default. View the [release notes](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/blog/acf-6-3-4) for more information\n* Fix - Users without the `edit_posts` capability but with custom capabilities for a editing a custom post type, can now correctly load field groups loaded via conditional location rules\n* Fix - Block validation no longer validates a field‚Äôs sub fields on page load, only on edit. This resolves inconsistent validation errors on page load or when first adding a block\n* Fix - Deactivating an ACF PRO license will now remove the license key even if the server call fails\n* Fix - Field types returning objects no longer cause PHP warnings and errors when output via `the_field`, `the_sub_field` or the ACF shortcode, or when retrieved by a `get_` function with the escape html parameter set\n* Fix - Server side errors during block rendering now gracefully displays an error to the editor\n\n= 6.3.3 =\n*Release Date 27th June 2024*\n\n* Enhancement - All dashicons are now available to the icon picker field type\n* Fix - mode=block\r\n\r\n=== Akismet Anti-spam: Spam Protection ===\nContributors: matt, ryan, andy, mdawaffe, tellyworth, josephscott, lessbloat, eoigal, cfinke, automattic, jgs, procifer, stephdau, kbrownkd, bluefuton, derekspringer, lschuyler, andyperdomo, akismetantispam\nTags: comments, spam, antispam, anti-spam, contact form\nRequires at least: 5.8\nTested up to: 6.8.1\nStable tag: 5.5\nLicense: GPLv2 or later\n\nThe best anti-spam protection to block spam comments and spam in a contact form. The most trusted antispam solution for WordPress and WooCommerce.\n\n== Description ==\n\nThe best anti-spam protection to block spam comments and spam in a contact form. The most trusted antispam solution for WordPress and WooCommerce.\n\nAkismet checks your comments and contact form submissions against our global database of spam to prevent your site from publishing malicious content. You can review the comment spam it catches on your blog's \"Comments\" admin screen.\n\nMajor features in Akismet include:\n\n* Automatically checks all comments and filters out the ones that look like spam.\n* Each comment has a status history, so you can easily see which comments were caught or cleared by Akismet and which were spammed or unspammed by a moderator.\n* URLs are shown in the comment body to reveal hidden or misleading links.\n* Moderators can see the number of approved comments for each user.\n* A discard feature that outright blocks the worst spam, saving you disk space and speeding up your site.\n\nPS: You'll be prompted to get an Akismet.com API key to use it, once activated. Keys are free for personal blogs; paid subscriptions are available for businesses and commercial sites.\n\n== Installation ==\n\nUpload the Akismet plugin to your blog, activate it, and then enter your Akismet.com API key.\n\n1, 2, 3: You're done!\n\n== Changelog ==\n\n= 5.5 =\n*Release Date - 15 July 2025*\n\n* Enable webhooks so that Akismet can process comments asynchronously to detect more types of spam.\n* Only include the Akismet widget CSS when the Akismet widget is present\n* Improve contrast/readability for certain UI elements\n\n= 5.4 =\n*Release Date - 7 May 2025*\n\n* The stats pages now use the user's locale instead of the site's locale if they're different.\n* Adds a 'Compatible plugins' section that will show installed and active plugins that are compatible with Akismet.\n* Akismet now requires PHP version 7.2 or above.\n\n= 5.3.7 =\n*Release Date - 14 February 2025*\n\n* Simplify the logic used during a comment-check request to compare comments.\n\n= 5.3.6 =\n*Release Date - 4 February 2025*\n\n* Improve the utility of submit-spam and submit-ham requests.\n* Modernize styles for the Akismet classic widget.\n\n= 5.3.5 =\n*Release Date - 18 November 2024*\n\n* Address compatibility issues with \u003c PHP 7.3 in v5.3.4 release.\n\n= 5.3.4 =\n*Release Date - 18 November 2024*\n\n* Improve activation notice on Comments for users who haven't set up their API key yet.\n* Improve notice about commercial site status.\n\n= 5.3.3 =\n*Release Date - 10 July 2024*\n\n* Make setup step clearer for new users.\n* Remove the stats section from the configuration page if the site has been revoked from the key.\n* Skip the Akismet comment check when the comment matches something in the disallowed list.\n* Prompt users on legacy plans to contact Akismet support for upgrades.\n\n= 5.3.2 =\n*Release Date - 21 March 2024*\n\n* Improve the empty state shown to new users when no spam has been caught yet.\n* Update the message shown to users without a current subscription.\n* Add foundations for future webhook support.\n\n= 5.3.1 =\n*Release Date - 17 January 2024*\n\n* Make the plugin more resilient when asset files are missing (as seen in WordPress Playground).\n* Add a link to the 'Account overview' page on akismet.com.\n* Fix a minor error that occurs when another plugin removes all comment actions from the dashboard.\n* Add the akismet_request_args filter to allow request args in Akismet API requests to be filtered.\n* Fix a bug that causes some contact forms to include unnecessary data in the comment_content parameter.\n\n= 5.3 =\n*Release Date - 21 June 2023*\n\n* Visual refresh of Akismet stats.\n* Improve PHP 8.1 compatibility.\n* Improve appearance of plugin to match updated stats.\n* Change minimum supported PHP version to 5.6 to match WordPress.\n* Drop IE11 support and update minimum WordPress version to 5.8 (where IE11 support was removed from WP Core).\n\n= 5.1 =\n*Release Date - Our plugin offers enterprise-grade reliability with beginner-friendly simplicity.\n\n**Why Choose All-in-One WP Migration?**\n\n* **Effortless Migration**: Export your entire site with a single click - including database, media, themes, and plugins\n* **Zero Downtime**: Complete your migration with no service interruptions\n* **Universal Compatibility**: Works across all hosting providers, from budget shared hosting to high-end dedicated servers\n* **Technical Excellence**: Engineered for reliability with memory-efficient processing (512KB chunks), ideal for resource-limited environments\n* **No Technical Skills Required**: Intuitive interface designed for users of all skill levels\n* **Cross-Database Support**: Seamlessly move between MySQL, MariaDB, and SQLite databases\n* **Secure \u0026 Reliable**: Trusted by Boeing, NASA, Harvard, Stanford, Automattic, and government agencies worldwide\n\n**How It Works - Simple as 1-2-3:**\n\n1. **Install** the plugin on your source and destination sites\n2. **Export** your site to a .wpress file with one click\n3. **Import** using our drag-and-drop importer on your destination site\n\n**For Developers \u0026 Power Users:**\n\n* **Advanced Find \u0026 Replace**: Control exactly what changes during migration\n* **Selective Content Migration**: Include/exclude specific content types\n* **PHP 5.3-8.4 Compatibility**: Works across virtually all hosting environments\n* **Custom WPress Format**: Our optimized archive format ensures data integrity\n* **Hook System**: Extensive API for custom integration and workflows\n* **Command-Line Support**: Automate migrations via WP-CLI\n\n**Premium Extensions:**\n\nEnhance your migration workflow with our [premium extensions](https://servmask.com/products) for:\n\n* **Unlimited Site Size**: Migrate sites of any size\n* **Cloud Storage Integration**: Direct migration to/from Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, and more\n* **Multisite Support**: Migrate complex WordPress networks\n* **Scheduled Backups**: Automated, recurring backups\n* **Database Filtering**: Exclude specific tables or data\n\n**Features Spotlight:**\n\n* WCAG 2.1 AA Level accessibility compliance\n* Mobile-responsive interface\n* [Browse WPRESS files online](https://traktor.servmask.com) or [extract locally](https://traktor.wp-migration.com)\n* Automatic URL and path replacement\n* WordPress Playground integration for SQLite/MySQL migration\n* Regular bi-weekly updates ensuring compatibility with the latest WordPress versions\n* Available in 50+ languages including Japanese\n\n**Trusted by the Government and Big Corporations:**\n\nMany enterprise customers, government organizations, and universities use, love, and trust All-in-One WP Migration. Error logs are now automatically deleted daily and during plugin updates. This vulnerability requires administrator-level access to exploit, ensuring that unauthorized users cannot perform this action. Our TruSEO score gives you detailed content \u0026 readability analysis, so you can get higher SEO rankings.\n\n* **Google Keyword Rank Tracking**\nEasily track how your website is ranking for different keywords in Google from your [WordPress dashboard](https://aioseo.com/features/search-statistics/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin 'Google Keyword Rank Tracker').\n\n* **Automatic Link Assistant**\nAutomate internal links between your pages using our smart [internal linking algorithm](https://aioseo.com/features/internal-link-assistant/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin 'Link Assistant') that will help improve on-page SEO.\n\n* **Local Business SEO**\nImprove your local SEO presence with local business schema, support for multiple local store locations, business opening hours, Google Maps integration, contact info (business email, business phone, business address, etc), and more with our [Local SEO module](https://aioseo.com/features/local-seo/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin 'Local SEO').\n\n* **Site Audit**\nGet a detailed report of SEO issues for all posts and terms on your site, discover why these issues are important and how you can fix them.\n\n* **SEO Revisions**\nKeep a [historical record of SEO changes](https://aioseo.com/seo-revisions/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin 'SEO Revisions'), monitor the impact of changes, and restore previous versions in one click.\n\n* **Content Decay Tracking**\nNever lose traffic to competitors. Quickly detect which content is losing traffic / SEO rankings, so you can optimize it to regain your rankings with our [Search Statistics module](https://aioseo.com/features/search-statistics/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin 'Search Statistics').\n\n* **Smart XML Sitemap**\nAdvanced XML sitemaps to boost your SEO rankings (with easy setup inside Google Search Console). Also includes Video SEO XML sitemap, News SEO XML sitemap, RSS sitemap, and HTML sitemap.\n\n* **Smart SEO Redirects**\nThe most powerful [SEO Redirection manager](https://aioseo.com/features/redirection-manager/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin 'Redirection Manager') for setting up advanced SEO redirects including 301 redirects, 302, 307, 410, 404 redirection, REGEX redirects, and more.\n\n* **404 Error Monitor**\nAutomatic 404 error monitor helps you track and redirect 404 errors, so you don't lose SEO rankings.\n\n* **Author SEO**\nAdd [custom author profile pages, author bio box, and relevant author schema](https://aioseo.com/features/author-seo-google-e-e-a-t/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin 'Author SEO (E-E-A-T)') to boost Google EEAT score to help with Google's Helpful Content Update (HCU).\n\n* **LLMs.txt Generator**\nGenerate an llms.txt file to help AI engines discover your site's content more easily so your content can rank in AI search results.\n\n* **SEO Audit Checklist**\nImprove your SEO ranking with our comprehensive SEO audit checklist.\n\n* **Knowledge Graph Support**\nImprove your website's search appearance with SEO Knowledge panel.\n\n* **Table of Contents**\nAutomatically generate a table of content, customize headings, anchors, and you can also hide or reorder the headings.\n\n### Advanced SEO Plugin Features ###\n\n* **User Access Control**\nControl who can manage your SEO settings with our advanced SEO access control.\n\n* **WordPress REST API**\nManage your SEO metadata with WordPress REST API. Great for headless WordPress installations.\n\n* **Advanced Robots Meta SEO Settings**\nGranular controls for no index, no follow, no archive, no snippet, max snippet, max video, etc.\n\n* **RSS Content for SEO**\nStop content scraping from hurting your SEO rankings.\n\n* **Full Site Redirects**\nMerging websites or switching domains? Full site redirect makes it easy to switch domains without losing SEO rankings.\n\n* **Smart Meta Title \u0026 Description**\nAutomatic SEO generation, dynamic SEO smart tags, include Emoji, add shortcodes, and more features to stand out in search results.\n\n* **Smart Breadcrumbs**\nAdd Breadcrumb navigation to improve user experience and boost your SEO rankings. Comes with full SEO JSON+LD support.\n\n* **Automatic Image SEO**\nHelps your images rank higher by autogenerating image title, clean SEO image filenames, and more.\n\n* **Advanced SEO Canonical URLs**\nPrevent duplicate content in SEO with automatic canonical URLs.\n\n* **SEO Cleanup / Manual SEO Penalty Removal**\nDomains Report feature in Link Assistant automatically removes all links for specific domains with just one click. Huge time saver when doing SEO cleanups.\n\n* **Link Opportunities Report**\nSee better internal link opportunities with our smart algorithm. Easily add internal links with just a few clicks.\n\n* **Robots.txt Editor**\nManage and customize SEO robots.txt files in WordPress.\n\n* **Crawl Quota Management**\nCrawl Cleanup feature manages your search engine crawl quota and index your important content faster.\n\n* **Title and Nofollow for SEO**\nEasily add title and nofollow to external links.\n\n* **Headline Analyzer**\nAnalyze your page / posts headlines to improve CTR and SEO rankings.\n\n* **Competitor Site SEO Analysis**\nUse competitor SEO analysis to outrank them with better SEO optimization.\n\n* **SEO Code Snippets**\nIntegration with [WPCode plugin](https://wordpress.org/plugins/insert-headers-and-footers/) for SEO code snippets to further customize every aspect of your SEO.\n\n\n### WordPress SEO Integrations ###\n\n* **Google Search Console Integration**\nConnect with Google webmaster tools and Google Search Console to see SEO insights (like content rankings, keyword rankings, page speed insights, post index status, etc) directly in your WordPress dashboard.\n\n* **WooCommerce SEO**\nImproves your WooCommerce SEO rankings. Easily optimize WooCommerce product pages, product categories, and more for best eCommerce SEO results.\n\n* **Knowledge Panel SEO**\nImprove website SEO appearance by adding social media profile links for Facebook, Twitter, Wikipedia, Instagram, LinkedIn, Yelp, YouTube, and more.\n\n* **Webmaster Tool Integrations**\nConnect with all webmaster tools including Google Search Console, Bing SEO, Yandex SEO, Baidu SEO, Google Analytics, Pinterest site verification, and more.\n\n* **Social Media Integration**\nFacebook SEO, Twitter SEO, and Pinterest SEO with better website previews.\n\n* **Google AMP SEO Integration**\nImprove your mobile SEO rankings with Google AMP SEO.\n\n* **Semrush SEO integration**\nSee additional SEO keywords with Semrush SEO integration.\n\n* **Microsoft Clarity Integration**\nSee visitor interactions with heatmaps and session recordings.\n\n* **IndexNow Integration**\nInstantly notify Bing and Yandex for faster SEO indexing.\n\n* **Elementor SEO**\nBetter Elementor SEO for landing pages.\n\n* **Divi SEO**\nBetter Divi SEO for landing pages.\n\n* **Avada SEO**\nBetter Avada SEO for landing pages.\n\n* **WP Bakery SEO**\nBetter WP Bakery SEO for landing pages.\n\n* **SeedProd SEO**\nOptimize SeedProd landing pages for SEO.\n\n* **SiteOrigin SEO**\nBetter SiteOrigin SEO for landing pages.\n\n* **Open Graph Support**\nImprove SEO rankings with open graph meta data.\n\n### WordPress SEO Plugin Importer ###\n\nNot happy with your current SEO plugin? We make SEO migration easy with our point-and-click automated SEO data transfer tool. We currently support SEO migration from following SEO tools:\n\n* Yoast SEO Importer\n* Yoast SEO Premium Importer\n* RankMath SEO Importer\n* SEOPress\n\nWe also support importing SEO redirects from the following plugins:\n\n* Redirection Plugin\n* Simple 301 Redirects Importer\n* Safe Redirect Manager\n* 301 Redirects Importer\n\nAside from that, our SEO migration tool also helps you with:\n\n* Import / Export AIOSEO settings from one site to another\n* Create SEO Settings Backup\n* CSV Sitemap Import to Import additional pages to your XML Sitemaps\n\n\n**Now you can see why AIOSEO is often rated the best SEO plugin in WordPress.**\n\nGive AIOSEO a try.\n\nWant to unlock more SEO features? AIOSEO documentation](https://aioseo.com/docs/?utm_source=wprepo\u0026utm_medium=link\u0026utm_campaign=liteplugin) before requesting support for SEO from the AIOSEO team.\n\n= Who should use AIOSEO? =\n\nSEO is essential for all websites. AIOSEO is perfect for business owners, bloggers, marketers, designers, developers, photographers, and basically everyone else. If you want to rank higher in search, then you need to use AIOSEO WordPress SEO plugin.\n\n= Which themes does AIOSEO support? =\n\nAIOSEO works with all WordPress themes. Simply enable AIOSEO to make your WordPress theme SEO friendly.\n\n= Will AIOSEO slow down my website? =\n\nNope, AIOSEO will NOT slow down your website. We understand that speed is important for SEO, that's why our code is properly optimized for maximum performance. Remember, faster websites rank higher in search. Use AIOSEO for fast SEO improvements.\n\n= Can I use AIOSEO on client sites? =\n\nYes, you can use AIOSEO on client websites.\n\n= Are AIOSEO sitemaps better than default WordPress sitemaps? =\n\nYes, AIOSEO smart sitemaps are a lot more optimized than the default WordPress sitemaps. Once you enable AIOSEO, our XML sitemaps will override the default WordPress sitemaps, so you can improve your SEO rankings.\n\nWe also offer advanced SEO sitemaps such as News Sitemap, Video Sitemap, and RSS Sitemap.\n\nOur SEO sitemaps come with granular control such as links per sitemap, enable / disable post types or taxonomies, include / exclude specific links from sitemap, add additional non-WordPress pages to sitemaps, customize sitemap priority \u0026 frequency for each section of your site, and more.\n\nThis is why experts rate AIOSEO as the best WordPress SEO plugin.\n\n= Does AIOSEO help with SEO Verification? =\n\nYes. AIOSEO can help you with website SEO verification with various webmaster tools such as Google Search Console, Bing Webmaster Tools, Yandex, Baidu, Pinterest, and just about every other site verification you need.\n\n= Why is AIOSEO better than other SEO plugins? =\n\nThere are many WordPress SEO plugins out there. Unlike others, AIOSEO WordPress SEO plugin is always reliable. Our SEO features are results focused (no bloat), and we offer exceptional customer support.\n\nAIOSEO is the original WordPress SEO plugin, and it's trusted by over 3 million website owners.\n\n= Do I really need an XML Sitemap? =\n\n**Yes! XML Sitemaps help Google and other search engines to find all the pages of your website.**\n\nAn XML sitemap is a list of all the content on your website. The sitemap helps search engine bots to easily see all the content on your site in one place, The XML sitemap file is hidden from your human visitors, however search engines like Google can see it.\n\nWithout an XML sitemap, some of your web pages may never be included in Google search results, and won't get any traffic.\n\nXML Sitemaps also help you tell Google which pages you DON'T want included in search results. This can help your SEO to prevent keyword cannibalization and duplicate content issues.\n\nAs part of your SEO strategy, **an XML sitemap can help you to improve your domain authority and unlock more traffic from Google, Bing and other search engines**.\n\nAIOSEO can easily help you get your sitemaps listed inside Google Search Console so your content can start to get indexed today!\n\n= Does AIOSEO integrate directly with Google Search Console? =\n\nAbsolutely! Our integration with Google Search Console allows you to monitor and maintain your website's presence on Google. With our direct integration, you can easily view important information about your website, such as the number of clicks, impressions, and the average position for each keyword that your website's content appears for in Google search results. You can also track your contents page speed using Google's Page Speed Insights directly inside your WordPress dashboard.\n\nAdditionally, AIOSEO can also provide you with data on the most frequently used keywords, the most popular pages on your website, and any crawl errors or security issues that may arise. By integrating with Google Search Console, AIOSEO provides website owners with valuable insights that can help to improve SEO and overall online visibility. With this integration, you can track your site's progress over time and make data-driven decisions that will help you achieve your SEO goals.\n\n== Screenshots ==\n\n1. Simple but flexible.\r\n\r\n== Description ==\r\n\r\nContact Form 7 is a plugin designed to be a practical tool for all WordPress users who embrace the philosophy of free and open source software. It employs sophisticatedly modularized architecture and its original [Schema-Woven Validation](https://contactform7.com/schema-woven-validation/) technology.\r\n\r\n= Docs and support =\r\n\r\nYou can find [docs](https://contactform7.com/docs/), [FAQ](https://contactform7.com/faq/) and more detailed information about Contact Form 7 on [contactform7.com](https://contactform7.com/). When you cannot find the answer to your question on the FAQ or in any of the documentation, check the [support forum](https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/contact-form-7/) on WordPress.org. If you cannot locate any topics that pertain to your particular issue, post a new topic for it.\r\n\r\n= Contact Form 7 needs your support =\r\n\r\nIt is hard to continue to maintain this plugin without support from users like you. There are several ways for you to [contribute to the project](https://contactform7.com/contributing/): testing, coding, translating it into your local languages, helping other users, financial donations, etc, etc. We equally welcome you regardless of the way you contribute.\r\n\r\n= Privacy notices =\r\n\r\nWith the default configuration, this plugin, in itself, does not:\r\n\r\n* track users by stealth;\r\n* write any user personal data to the database;\r\n* send any data to external servers;\r\n* use cookies.\r\n\r\nIf you activate certain features in this plugin, the contact form submitter's personal data, including their IP address, may be sent to the service provider. Thus, confirming the provider's privacy policy is recommended. These features include:\r\n\r\n* reCAPTCHA ([Google](https://policies.google.com/?hl=en))\r\n* Akismet ([Automattic](https://automattic.com/privacy/))\r\n* [Constant Contact](https://www.constantcontact.com/legal/privacy-center)\r\n* [Brevo](https://www.brevo.com/legal/privacypolicy/)\r\n* [Stripe](https://stripe.com/privacy)\r\n* Turnstile ([Cloudflare](https://www.cloudflare.com/turnstile-privacy-policy/))\r\n\r\n== Installation ==\r\n\r\n1. Upload the entire `contact-form-7` folder to the `/wp-content/plugins/` directory.\r\n1. Activate the plugin through the **Plugins** screen (**Plugins \u003e Installed Plugins**).\r\n\r\nYou will find **Contact** menu in your WordPress admin screen.\r\n\r\nFor basic usage, have a look at the [plugin's website](https://contactform7.com/).\r\n\r\n== Frequently Asked Questions ==\r\n\r\nDo you have questions or issues with Contact Form 7? You can duplicate your pages, posts and custom post by just one click and it will save as your selected options (draft, private, public, pending).\n\n= Key Features in Duplicate Page Pro Editions =\n\n* **User Roles:** Allow User Roles To access Duplicate Page.\n* **Post Types:** Filter to show Duplicate Page link in post types.\n* **Clone Link Location:** Option where to show clone link.\n* **Status:** Option to select Duplicate Posts Status.\n* **Redirection:** Option to Redirect after click on clone link..\n* **Clone Link Title:** Option to change Duplicate Post Link Title.\n* **Post Prefix:** Option to add Post Prefix.\n* **Post Suffix:** Option to add Post Suffix.\n* **Editor**: And Many More Filters and Features.\n\n\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e[Buy Pro Version](https://duplicatepro.com/pro/?utm_source=Wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=Website\u0026utm_campaign=Duplicate%20Page%20Pro)\u003c/strong\u003e with various features \u0026 support.\n\n\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e[Contact us](https://duplicatepro.com/contact/?utm_source=Wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=Website\u0026utm_campaign=Duplicate%20Page%20Pro)\u003c/strong\u003e for Support Only Pro Version Users.\n\n**[Upgrade to Pro Version](https://duplicatepro.com/pro/?utm_source=Wordpress.org\u0026utm_medium=Website\u0026utm_campaign=Duplicate%20Page%20Pro)**\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fj8BHxvebXs\u0026feature=youtu.be\n\n== Installation ==\n\n1. Upload the `duplicate-page` folder to the directory `/wp-content/plugins/`.\n2. Activate the plugin using the 'Plugins' menu in WordPress.\n\n== Frequently asked questions ==\n\n## How to use\n\n1. First Activate Plugin.\n2. Go Select to Duplicate Page settings Menu from Settings Tab and savings settings. \n1. Then Create New Post/Page or Use old.\n2. After click on duplicate this link, then duplicate post/ page will be created and saved as draft,publish,pending,private depending upon settings.\n\n== Screenshots ==\n\n1. Activate Screen \n2. Duplicate Page Settings Screen\n3. Select Option from Settings Page.\n4. Click on Duplicate This. \n5. Duplicate Post / Page will Appear. \n\n== Changelog ==\n\n= 4.5.5 (9th June, 2025) =\n* Compatible with WordPress 6.8.1\n\n\n= 4.5.4 (29th July, 2024) =\n* Compatible with WordPress 6.6.1\n\n= See the most important Google Analytics data in an easy to understand report, right inside your WordPress dashboard (Save 5 minutes each day).\n* Publisher Report - See exactly which content gets the most visit, which affiliate links are performing the best, what new partnership opportunities you should pursue, and more.\n* Ecommerce Report - See all your important online store metrics in one place such as total revenue, conversion rate, average order value, top products, top conversion sources, and more.\n* Search Console Report - See how well your website is ranking in Google, so you can optimize your SEO to grow your traffic.\n* Forms Report - See your conversion stats for various contact forms and lead forms on your website to improve conversions.\n* Custom Dimensions Report - See useful stats like most popular authors, best publication times, popular categories, tags, Yoast focus keywords, SEO score, etc.\n* Real Time Report - see who is online on your website in real-time, right inside your WordPress dashboard.\n* Customizable Google Analytics Dashboard Widget - Our dashboard widget allows you to have quick access to your most important stats at the moment you login to your WordPress dashboard.\n* Page Insights in Admin Bar - Easily view analytics for each individual page and post from the ExactMetrics menu in WordPress admin bar while browsing your website.\n* Landing Page Report - Shows you which pages your visitors land, without needing to log into Google Analytics.\n* Source and Medium Report - gives you an easy view of Google Analytics UTM tracking.\n* Technology Report - See which devices and browsers use your website the most.\n* Campaign Report - Shows you Google Analytics UTM tracking and key metrics.\n* Pages Report - See which pages are most poplular on your website.\n* Coupon Report - See which coupons are used most on your website.\n* Funnel Report - See how people buy from your store.\n* Email Summaries - Get the most important metrics delivered to you and/or your client's email inboxes weekly with our brandable Email Summaries, allowing you to keep up to date on your website's Google Analytics results even without needing to login to the Google Analytics dashboard.\n* PDF Exports - Easily take your ExactMetrics reports with you or send them to clients or colleagues by exporting all ExactMetrics reports as a brandable PDF.\n* Site Speed Report - helps you improve your website‚Äôs performance by displaying key metrics and actionable tips to improve those based on WordPress-specific solutions.\n* Popular Posts - Display popular posts in your post content automatically or using Gutenberg blocks and shortcodes. Show off your top posts to your visitors using sidebar widgets, Gutenberg blocks or shortcodes\n\n= Integrations =\n\n* WooCommerce Google Analytics - Automatically setup Google analytics enhanced eCommerce tracking for WooCommerce and WooCommerce analytics.\n* Easy Digital Downloads Google Analytics -
